source_file: Gleason - 2016 - Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Cause of Diffuse Miliary Pattern Pulmonary Opacities.pdf

evidence.exact_quote: A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
A 63 year old female presented for incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules.
she denied any respiratory complaints including dyspnea, cough or sputum production
transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis

evidence.extracted_value: Innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern, no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy
evidence.exact_quote: The Computed Tomography (CT) scan of the chest with contrast showed innumerable and diffusely distributed nodules up to 4mm in a military type pattern. There was no mediastinal or hilar adenopathy

evidence.extracted_value: Many meningothelial like bodies confirming Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
evidence.exact_quote: transbronchial biopsies revealed many meningothelial like bodies confirming the diagnosis of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis
Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography (PET/CT) scan of our patient did not reveal abnormalities suggestive of underlying malignancy.

evidence.extracted_value: 10 pack-year smoking history, occupational chemical fume exposure
evidence.exact_quote: Medical, social and family history was remarkable for a 10 pack-year smoking history and occupational chemical fume exposure, working in a compounding pharmacy.
